comments:
Using the new plugin wizard on both the Hello World and Views examples the
following behaviour is observed.

On 3.1.2 the plugins can be run/debugged as an eclipse application in a new eclipse instance. The only change made to the default installation was to the projects plugin.xml, on the runtime tab of the plugin manifest editor the exported packages had the project packages added.

On 3.2.RC6 (Eclipse SDK for Windows IA32 I20060526-0010) the plugins do not run.
Again, the only change was to add the exported packages.
The Views examples gives a classnotfound exception for the plugin class when the view is added to a perspective.
The HelloWorld example gives a dialog box stating that the function is not available (presumably the classnotfound was thrown and caught).
The interesting point is that if the project is manually exported as a plugin, and installed in the eclipse plugin directory the plugin works fine (after
restarting eclipse).

I only have two weeks experience with eclipse and can not determine where the problem might lie. The wizard might have missed part of the setup, the build might be failing to make the jar, the runtime/debug might have the wrong classpath.
It should be easy to reproduce.
Just tried with 3.2.RC7 and this is still an issue.

The scenarios you describe are pretty basic scenarios that work just fine.

Do you have reproducible steps?

As mentioned earlier, I am fairly new to this, and I expect it is fairly basic stuff.

As mention earlier, these actions work on 3.1.2 out of the box, they do not work on 3.2 RC6 or RC7.

Download Eclipse SDK.
Unzip.
Run eclipse.exe with no parameters.
File > New > Project 
Plugin-Develpment > Plugin Project > Next
Project name = mb > Next
Next
Plugin with a view > Next
Tree viewer > Next > Finish
This takes me to the mb overview tab (in the manifest editor?)
Select runtime tab
Exported Packages > Add...
Select both entries > Ok
Select Run as... eclipse application
Save mb > Ok (since the changes above were not saved yet)

A new eclipse launches
Window > Show View > Other...
Sample Catagory > Sample View > Ok

On Eclipse 3.1.2 this adds a view with the elements one, two and three.
On Eclipse 3.2 there is an error message and details button.
The error message reads:
Unable to create view: Plug-in mb was unable to load class mb.views.SampleView
The details button gives:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: mb.views.Sampleview
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java(Compiled Code))
...

Note: If the project is exported as a plug-in and placed in the plug-in directory and eclipse is restarted, then the plugin works. So the problem
is specific to run and debug modes of eclipse development. Given that
exactly the same actions on 3.1.2 work, it something new/changed in 3.2.
I was unable to reproduce the issue - the sample view opened up without any problems. Michael, could you attach the project that does not work for you?

we could not reproduce the problem, even with the given workspace.

There is no bug here.

If you need help, I suggest asking on the newsgoups.
